task_summary: Pick up the red object from the table using a robot arm—perceive, approach, grasp, and lift as demonstrated across frames 0–8.

task_long_description.overview: The robot is tasked with picking up a small red cylindrical object from a black table. The scene includes various blue markers for spatial referencing. The robot begins by perceiving the table and locating the red object, aligns itself above the object, carefully grasps it from the top, verifies grasp stability, and then lifts the object from the table. The behavior is designed for reliability despite possible perception or grasp failures, using retries when needed.
preconditions: Red object placed on the table within workspace
stepwise_plan: Perceive the workspace and locate the red object (frames 0–1)
Open gripper and move above the red object (frames 2–3)
Lower until gentle contact is detected (frames 4–5)
Close the gripper to grasp with moderate force (frames 5–6)
Verify grasp stability and object in gripper (frames 6)
Raise the object above the table (frames 7–8)
success_criteria: Object is stably held in gripper
failure_and_recovery: Object not visible: retry scanning up to 3 times
Failed grasp: release and try again
Contact not detected: lower again within safe depth
Grasp not stable: release, re-align and retry
task_long_description.termination: End when red object is clearly lifted and stably held in the gripper above the table.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: pick up the red object from the table

node_specs.description: Checks if red object is visible
Scan workspace for red object using spiral pattern
Detects precise location of red object
Opens gripper to suitable width for pick
Computes grasp pose from above for red object
Lowers gripper until light contact detected
Closes gripper to grasp red object
Confirms red object held in gripper
Lifts the red object above the table

failure_modes: Object not detected due to occlusion or misplacement
Grasp not stable (object slips or not secured)
recovery_strategy: Realign and lower repeatedly within safe max depth
Release and retry grasp if not stable or object not in gripper
assumptions: Instruction requests a simple pick action; frames confirm the red object is present and isolated for grasping.
The object category and grasp pose derived from frames; no color or shape conflict.
No complex placement required (per instruction and frames).
Table markers aid spatial calibration but are not manipulated.

expected_success_criteria: Red object securely grasped and visibly lifted
No collision or excessive force applied
Object is not dropped during process
